chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley R Cournoyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs shall be paid as a condition of probation in count 3.   If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Court authorizes transfer to Waukesha County Jail.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Costs imposed in count 2 shall be paid as a condition of probation in this count.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with Plat Elementary School or any school within the Richfield School District without prior agent approval.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
